div.p: It wasn’t too bad but when I got to about the end of Year 9 my mum and dad split up and I took it really badly
so I refused to go to school, I was really depressed and I just would not go to school; the teachers didn’t really understand,
they didn’t support me at all and so I did have a long time off school until my mum arranged for me to have a home tutor
where I just took 4 GCSEs that I knew I’d pass to get me onto the college course that I wanted to do which was Performing Arts
because the only thing that kept me going was the fact that I wanted to be a dancer and that’s the only thing I would do
when I was feeling down and that’s the only thing that kept me going because, you know, I was so focused on being a performer
I think that’s what got me through it really. People at that age like especially young kids of that age like 14 or 15
they don’t know do they? Like they don’t understand that there’s obviously a reason why I was feeling like I was
